title: Parameter service
body:
The first iteration of the API for the Parameter Service with a simple example. The client sets up a ParameterServiceBuilder which can then be configured on the driver to create a ParameterService object. The ParameterService allows one request for evaluators with the right parameters that adjust the requirements for running the parameter service itself. Then the Context and Service for creating the ParameterServer is submitted. The ctor of the ParameterServer also guarantees registration with the NameService. So when all submitted contexts are active we know all parameter servers are running and listening on their respective ip & ports. As in the case of Group Communication, the user submits a partial task configuration, with the configuration required for his task, to the ParameterService. The ParameterService waits till all Contexts submitted are active and submits the tasks by merging the user config with the config for the ParameterClient. The ParameterClient configuration essentially needs the ip & ports of all listening ParameterServers. This is obtained by querying the NameService. This completes the creation of ParameterServers that run as a service and the injection of a ParameterClient object at the task. Again, there are several simplifying assumptions to get this to this shape.
1. All tasks run one instance of the ParameterServer
2. The only supported forms of parameters are matrices split across multiple tables. All entries are assumed to be uniform.
3. There is no implementation of the actual functional interfaces yet. This version only has the integration points into REEF.

title: [REEF-1177] Delete mstest packages from .csproj files
body:
This change
- removes Microsoft.VisualStudio.QualityTools.UnitTestFramework
  from .csproj files, so that new mstest tests can't be created without
  being evident.
- migrates ReefFunctionalTest.cs to xUnit.

  [REEF-1177](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1177)

Pull request:
  This closes #

body:
…cation and per-job

This addressed the issue by
- Add and modify avro files to reflect job and application specific parameters.
- Modify command line arguments for C# submission.
- Modify Java submission client and handlers to reflect change in submission arguments.

title: [REEF-1181] Add dockerfiles for Mesos 0.26
body:
This adds dockerfiles for integration tests on Mesos 0.27.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1181](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1181)

Pull Request:
  Closes #

title: [REEF-1136] Implementing standalone runtime high-level interface
body:
This addressed the issue by
- Implementing basic high-level interface for standalone runtime.
- `NodeListFilePath` is a required parameter.
- The file contains lines of ssh info. (e.g. reefuser@localhost)
- Upon resource request, the runtime selects a node from it.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1136](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1136)

title: [REEF-1179] Pass Mesos Integration Tests
body:
This fixes the following missing parts from the previous commits:
- Mesos needs to replace RemoteConfiguration.ManagerName.
  Do not use the given injector having `REEF_LAUNCHER`.
  - [REEF-991] Remove deprecated RangeTcpPortProvider.Default
    and DefaultRemoteManagerImplementation constructor
- Adds Runtime Identifier to Mesos Runtime.
  - [REEF-983] Add Runtime Identifier to the EvaluatorDescriptor
- Removes TempFileCreator binding.
  - [REEF-1013] C# Evaluator does not work on HDInsight

title: [REEF-375] reef.net build fails if M2_HOME path has a space in it
body:
Use `CALL "$(M2_HOME)\bin\mvn.cmd" ...` to invoke Maven. That construct works even when `$M2_HOME` has spaces in it (e.g. when Maven is installed under `\Program Files`)

JIRA: [REEF-375](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-375)

title: [REEF-1146] Support Context Events
body:
This addressed the issue by
- Support ContextStart and ContextStop.
- Set up initial structure to support ContextMessages and messages from Driver to Context.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1146](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1146)

title: [REEF-1178] Remove author information from source code
body:
ASF strongly recommends to remove @author tags
because @author tags imply individual ownership.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1178](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1178)

Pull Request:
  Closes #
